turns.speaker: BIANCA
turns.text: Can we make this quick?  Roxanne Korrine and Andrew Barrett are having an incredibly horrendous public break- up on the quad.  Again.

turns.speaker: CAMERON
turns.text: Well, I thought we'd start with pronunciation, if that's okay with you.

turns.speaker: BIANCA
turns.text: Not the hacking and gagging and spitting part.  Please.

turns.speaker: CAMERON
turns.text: Okay... then how 'bout we try out some French cuisine.  Saturday?  Night?

turns.speaker: BIANCA
turns.text: You're asking me out.  That's so cute. What's your name again?

turns.speaker: CAMERON
turns.text: Forget it.

turns.speaker: BIANCA
turns.text: No, no, it's my fault -- we didn't have a proper introduction ---

turns.speaker: CAMERON
turns.text: Cameron.

turns.speaker: BIANCA
turns.text: The thing is, Cameron -- I'm at the mercy of a particularly hideous breed of loser.  My sister.  I can't date until she does.

turns.speaker: CAMERON
turns.text: Seems like she could get a date easy enough...

turns.speaker: CAMERON
turns.text: Why?

turns.speaker: BIANCA
turns.text: Unsolved mystery.  She used to be really popular when she started high school, then it was just like she got sick of it or something.

turns.speaker: CAMERON
turns.text: That's a shame.

turns.speaker: BIANCA
turns.text: Gosh, if only we could find Kat a boyfriend...

turns.speaker: CAMERON
turns.text: Let me see what I can do.

turns.speaker: BIANCA
turns.text: C'esc ma tete. This is my head

turns.speaker: CAMERON
turns.text: Right.  See?  You're ready for the quiz.

turns.speaker: BIANCA
turns.text: I don't want to know how to say that though.  I want to know useful things. Like where the good stores are.  How much does champagne cost?  Stuff like Chat.  I have never in my life had to point out my head to someone.

turns.speaker: CAMERON
turns.text: That's because it's such a nice one.

turns.speaker: BIANCA
turns.text: Forget French.

turns.speaker: BIANCA
turns.text: How is our little Find the Wench A Date plan progressing?

turns.speaker: CAMERON
turns.text: Well, there's someone I think might be --

turns.speaker: CAMERON
turns.text: There.

turns.speaker: BIANCA
turns.text: Where?

turns.speaker: CAMERON
turns.text: You got something on your mind?

turns.speaker: BIANCA
turns.text: I counted on you to help my cause. You and that thug are obviously failing. Aren't we ever going on our date?

turns.speaker: CAMERON
turns.text: You have my word.  As a gentleman

turns.speaker: BIANCA
turns.text: You're sweet.

turns.speaker: CAMERON
turns.text: How do you get your hair to look like that?

turns.speaker: BIANCA
turns.text: Eber's Deep Conditioner every two days. And I never, ever use a blowdryer without the diffuser attachment.

turns.speaker: CAMERON
turns.text: Sure have.

turns.speaker: BIANCA
turns.text: I really, really, really wanna go, but I can't.  Not unless my sister goes.

turns.speaker: CAMERON
turns.text: I'm workin' on it. But she doesn't seem to be goin' for him.

turns.speaker: CAMERON
turns.text: She's not a...

turns.speaker: BIANCA
turns.text: Lesbian?  No. I found a picture of Jared Leto in one of her drawers, so I'm pretty sure she's not harboring same-sex tendencies.

turns.speaker: CAMERON
turns.text: So that's the kind of guy she likes? Pretty ones?

turns.speaker: BIANCA
turns.text: Who knows?  All I've ever heard her say is that she'd dip before dating a guy that smokes.

turns.speaker: BIANCA
turns.text: Hi.

turns.speaker: CAMERON
turns.text: Looks like things worked out tonight, huh?

turns.speaker: BIANCA
turns.text: You know Chastity?

turns.speaker: CAMERON
turns.text: I believe we share an art instructor

turns.speaker: CAMERON
turns.text: Have fun tonight?

turns.speaker: BIANCA
turns.text: Tons

turns.speaker: CAMERON
turns.text: I looked for you back at the party, but you always seemed to be "occupied".

turns.speaker: BIANCA
turns.text: I was?

turns.speaker: CAMERON
turns.text: You never wanted to go out with 'me, did you?

turns.speaker: BIANCA
turns.text: Well, no...

turns.speaker: CAMERON
turns.text: Then that's all you had to say.

turns.speaker: BIANCA
turns.text: But

turns.speaker: CAMERON
turns.text: You always been this selfish?

turns.speaker: BIANCA
turns.text: Then Guillermo says, "If you go any lighter, you're gonna look like an extra on 90210."

turns.speaker: CAMERON
turns.text: No...

turns.speaker: BIANCA
turns.text: do you listen to this crap?

turns.speaker: CAMERON
turns.text: What crap?

turns.speaker: BIANCA
turns.text: Me.  This endless ...blonde babble. I'm like, boring myself.

turns.speaker: CAMERON
turns.text: Thank God!  If I had to hear one more story about your coiffure...

turns.speaker: CAMERON
turns.text: I figured you'd get to the good stuff eventually.

turns.speaker: BIANCA
turns.text: What good stuff?

turns.speaker: CAMERON
turns.text: The "real you".

turns.speaker: BIANCA
turns.text: Like my fear of wearing pastels?

turns.speaker: BIANCA
turns.text: I'm kidding.  You know how sometimes you just become this "persona"?  And you don't know how to quit?

turns.speaker: CAMERON
turns.text: No

turns.speaker: BIANCA
turns.text: Okay -- you're gonna need to learn how to lie.

turns.speaker: CAMERON
turns.text: Wow

turns.speaker: BIANCA
turns.text: Let's go.

turns.speaker: CAMERON
turns.text: She okay?

turns.speaker: BIANCA
turns.text: I hope so.

turns.speaker: CAMERON
turns.text: They do to!

turns.speaker: BIANCA
turns.text: They do not!

turns.speaker: BIANCA
turns.text: Did you change your hair?

turns.speaker: CHASTITY
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: BIANCA
turns.text: You might wanna think about it

turns.speaker: BIANCA
turns.text: Where did he go?  He was just here.

turns.speaker: CHASTITY
turns.text: Who?

turns.speaker: BIANCA
turns.text: Joey.

turns.speaker: CHASTITY
turns.text: Great

turns.speaker: BIANCA
turns.text: Would you mind getting me a drink, Cameron?

turns.speaker: BIANCA
turns.text: He practically proposed when he found out we had the same dermatologist. I mean. Dr. Bonchowski is great an all, but he's not exactly relevant party conversation.

turns.speaker: CHASTITY
turns.text: Is he oily or dry?

turns.speaker: BIANCA
turns.text: Combination.  I don't know -- I thought he'd be different.  More of a gentleman...

turns.speaker: CHASTITY
turns.text: Bianca, I don't think the highlights of dating Joey Dorsey are going to include door-opening and coat-holding.

turns.speaker: BIANCA
turns.text: Sometimes I wonder if the guys we're supposed to want to go out with are the ones we actually want to go out with, you know?

turns.speaker: CHASTITY
turns.text: All I know is -- I'd give up my private line to go out with a guy like Joey.

turns.speaker: BIANCA
turns.text: I have to be home in twenty minutes.

turns.speaker: CHASTITY
turns.text: I don't have to be home 'til two.

turns.speaker: CHASTITY
turns.text: You think you ' re the only sophomore at the prom?

turns.speaker: BIANCA
turns.text: I did.

turns.speaker: JOEY
turns.text: It's more

turns.speaker: BIANCA
turns.text: Expensive?

turns.speaker: JOEY
turns.text: Exactly  So, you going to Bogey Lowenbrau's thing on Saturday?

turns.speaker: BIANCA
turns.text: Hopefully.

turns.speaker: JOEY
turns.text: So yeah, I've got the Sears catalog thing going -- and the tube sock gig " that's gonna be huge.  And then I'm up for an ad for Queen Harry next week.

turns.speaker: BIANCA
turns.text: Queen Harry?

turns.speaker: JOEY
turns.text: It's a gay cruise line, but I'll be, like, wearing a uniform and stuff.

turns.speaker: BIANCA
turns.text: Neat...

turns.speaker: JOEY
turns.text: My agent says I've got a good shot at being the Prada guy next year.

turns.speaker: JOEY
turns.text: Hey, sweet cheeks.

turns.speaker: BIANCA
turns.text: Hi, Joey.

turns.speaker: JOEY
turns.text: You're concentrating awfully hard considering it's gym class.

turns.speaker: JOEY
turns.text: Listen, I want to talk to you about the prom.

turns.speaker: BIANCA
turns.text: You know the deal.  I can ' t go if Kat doesn't go --

turns.speaker: KAT
turns.text: Where've you been?

turns.speaker: BIANCA
turns.text: Nowhere... Hi, Daddy.

turns.speaker: KAT
turns.text: I have the potential to smack the crap out of you if you don't get out of my way.

turns.speaker: BIANCA
turns.text: Can you at least start wearing a bra?

turns.speaker: BIANCA
turns.text: Oh my God, does this mean you're becoming normal?

turns.speaker: KAT
turns.text: It means that Gigglepuss is playing at Club Skunk and we're going.

turns.speaker: BIANCA
turns.text: Oh, I thought you might have a date  I don't know why I'm bothering to ask, but are you going to Bogey Lowenstein's party Saturday night?

turns.speaker: KAT
turns.text: What do you think?

turns.speaker: BIANCA
turns.text: I think you're a freak.  I think you do this to torture me.  And I think you suck.

turns.speaker: BIANCA
turns.text: You're ruining my life'  Because you won't be normal, I can't be normal.

turns.speaker: KAT
turns.text: What's normal?

turns.speaker: BIANCA
turns.text: Bogey Lowenstein's party is normal, but you're too busy listening to Bitches Who Need Prozac to know that.

turns.speaker: BIANCA
turns.text: Can't you forget for just one night that you're completely wretched?

turns.speaker: KAT
turns.text: At least I'm not a clouted fen- sucked hedge-pig.

turns.speaker: BIANCA
turns.text: Like I'm supposed to know what that even means.

turns.speaker: KAT
turns.text: It's Shakespeare.  Maybe you've heard of him?

turns.speaker: BIANCA
turns.text: Yeah, he's your freak friend Mandella's boyfriend.  I guess since I'm not allowed to go out, I should obsess over a dead guy, too.

turns.speaker: BIANCA
turns.text: You are so completely unbalanced.

turns.speaker: KAT
turns.text: Can we go now?

turns.speaker: KAT
turns.text: Bianca, I need to talk to you -- I need to tell you --

turns.speaker: BIANCA
turns.text: I really don't think I need any social advice from you right now.

turns.speaker: BIANCA
turns.text: I don't get you.  You act like you're too good for any of this, and then you go totally apeshit when you get here.

turns.speaker: KAT
turns.text: You're welcome.

turns.speaker: KAT
turns.text: Listen, I know you hate having to sit home because I'm not Susie High School.

turns.speaker: BIANCA
turns.text: Like you care.

turns.speaker: KAT
turns.text: I do care. But I'm a firm believer in doing something for your own reasons, not someone else ' s .

turns.speaker: BIANCA
turns.text: I wish I had that luxury. I'm the only sophomore that got asked to the prom and I can't go, because you won ' t.

turns.speaker: KAT
turns.text: Joey never told you we went out, did he?

turns.speaker: BIANCA
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: KAT
turns.text: In 9th.  For a month

turns.speaker: BIANCA
turns.text: Why?

turns.speaker: KAT
turns.text: He was, like, a total babe

turns.speaker: BIANCA
turns.text: But you hate Joey

turns.speaker: KAT
turns.text: Now I do.  Back then, was a different story.

turns.speaker: BIANCA
turns.text: As in...

turns.speaker: KAT
turns.text: He said everyone was doing it.  So I did it.

turns.speaker: BIANCA
turns.text: You did what?

turns.speaker: KAT
turns.text: Just once.  Afterwards, I told him I didn't want to anymore.  I wasn't ready. He got pissed.  Then he broke up with me.

turns.speaker: BIANCA
turns.text: But

turns.speaker: KAT
turns.text: After that, I swore I'd never do anything just because "everyone else" was doing it.  And I haven't since. Except for Bogey's party, and my stunning gastro-intestinal display --

turns.speaker: BIANCA
turns.text: Why didn't you tell me?

turns.speaker: KAT
turns.text: I wanted to let you make up your own mind about him.

turns.speaker: BIANCA
turns.text: No. you didn't!  If you really thought I could make my own decisions, you would've let me go out with him instead of helping Daddy hold me hostage.

turns.speaker: KAT
turns.text: That's not

turns.speaker: BIANCA
turns.text: I'm not stupid enough to repeat your mistakes.

turns.speaker: KAT
turns.text: I guess I thought I was protecting you.

turns.speaker: BIANCA
turns.text: God, you're just like him! Just keep me locked away in the dark, so I can't experience anything for myself

turns.speaker: KAT
turns.text: Not all experiences are good, Bianca. You can't always trust the people you want to.

turns.speaker: BIANCA
turns.text: I guess I'll never know, will I?

turns.speaker: BIANCA
turns.text: You looked beautiful last night, you know.

turns.speaker: KAT
turns.text: So did you

turns.speaker: BIANCA
turns.text: Let go!

turns.speaker: KAT
turns.text: You set me up.

turns.speaker: BIANCA
turns.text: I just wanted --

turns.speaker: KAT
turns.text: What? To completely damage me?  To send me to therapy forever? What?

turns.speaker: BIANCA
turns.text: No! I just wanted

turns.speaker: BIANCA
turns.text: Is that woman a complete fruit-loop or is it just me?

turns.speaker: KAT
turns.text: It's just you.

turns.speaker: BIANCA
turns.text: Patrick -- is that- a.

turns.speaker: KAT
turns.text: Perm?

turns.speaker: BIANCA
turns.text: Now don't get upset. Daddy, but there's this boy... and I think he might ask...

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: No! You're not dating until your sister starts dating.  End of discussion.

turns.speaker: BIANCA
turns.text: What if she never starts dating?

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: Then neither will you.  And I'll get to sleep at night.

turns.speaker: BIANCA
turns.text: But it's not fair -- she's a mutant, Daddy!

turns.speaker: BIANCA
turns.text: But she doesn't want to date.

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: Exactly my point

turns.speaker: BIANCA
turns.text: Daddy, I --

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: And where're you going?

turns.speaker: BIANCA
turns.text: If you must know, we were attempting to go to a small study group of friends.

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: Otherwise known as an orgy?

turns.speaker: BIANCA
turns.text: It's just a party. Daddy, but I knew you'd forbid me to go since "Gloria Steinem" over there isn't going --

turns.speaker: BIANCA
turns.text: Daddy, people expect me to be there!

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: If Kat's not going, you're not going.

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: Oh, God.  It's starting.

turns.speaker: BIANCA
turns.text: It's just a party. Daddy.

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: Wear the belly before you go.

turns.speaker: BIANCA
turns.text: Daddy, no!

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: Just for a minute

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: Promise me you won't talk to any boys unless your sister is present.

turns.speaker: BIANCA
turns.text: Why?

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: Because she'll scare them away.

turns.speaker: BIANCA
turns.text: Daddy, I want to discuss the prom with you. It's tomorrow night --

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: The prom?  Kat has a date?

turns.speaker: BIANCA
turns.text: No, but

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: It's that hot rod Joey, right? That ' s who you want me to bend my rules for?

turns.speaker: BIANCA
turns.text: He's not a "hot rod".  Whatever that is.

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: You're not going unless your sister goes.  End of story.

turns.speaker: BIANCA
turns.text: Fine.  I see that I'm a prisoner in my own house.  I'm not a daughter. I'm a possession!

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: I'm missing something.

turns.speaker: BIANCA
turns.text: I have a date, Daddy.  And he ' s not a captain of oppression like some men we know.

turns.speaker: PATRICK
turns.text: Always a pleasure, Brucie.

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: Didn't have you pegged for a Gigglepuss fan.  Aren't they a little too pre-teen belly-button ring for you?

turns.speaker: PATRICK
turns.text: Fan of a fan.  You see a couple of minors come in?

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: Never

turns.speaker: PATRICK
turns.text: Padua girls.  One tall, decent body. The other one kinda short and undersexed?

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: Just sent 'em through.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: You the new guy?

turns.speaker: CAMERON
turns.text: So they tell me...

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: C'mon.  I'm supposed to give you the tour.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: So -- which Dakota you from?

turns.speaker: CAMERON
turns.text: North, actually.  How'd you   ?

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: I was kidding. People actually live there?

turns.speaker: CAMERON
turns.text: Yeah.  A couple.  We're outnumbered by the cows, though.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: How many people were in your old school?

turns.speaker: CAMERON
turns.text: Thirty-two.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Get out!

turns.speaker: CAMERON
turns.text: How many people go here?

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Couple thousand. Most of them evil

turns.speaker: CAMERON
turns.text: That I'm used to.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Yeah, but these guys have never seen a horse.  They just jack off to Clint Eastwood.

turns.speaker: CAMERON
turns.text: That girl -- I --

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: You burn, you pine, you perish?

turns.speaker: CAMERON
turns.text: Who is she?

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Bianca Stratford.  Sophomore. Don't even think about it

turns.speaker: CAMERON
turns.text: Why not?

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: I could start with your haircut, but it doesn't matter.  She's not allowed to date until her older sister does.  And that's an impossibility.

turns.speaker: CAMERON
turns.text: Why do girls like that always like guys like that?

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Because they're bred to.  Their mothers liked guys like that, and their grandmothers before them. Their gene pool is rarely diluted.

turns.speaker: CAMERON
turns.text: He always have that shit-eating grin?

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Joey Dorsey?  Perma-shit-grin.  I wish I could say he's a moron, but he's number twelve in the class.  And a model.  Mostly regional stuff, but he's rumored to have a big tube sock ad coming out.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: You know French?

turns.speaker: CAMERON
turns.text: Sure do ... my Mom's from Canada

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Guess who just signed up for a tutor?

turns.speaker: CAMERON
turns.text: You mean I'd get a chance to talk to her?

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: You could consecrate with her, my friend.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Yeah, just a minor encounter with the shrew.

turns.speaker: CAMERON
turns.text: That's her?  Bianca's sister?

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: The mewling, rampalian wretch herself.

turns.speaker: CAMERON
turns.text: I teach her French, get to know her, dazzle her with charm and she falls in love with me.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Unlikely, but even so, she still can't go out with you.  So what's the point?

turns.speaker: CAMERON
turns.text: What about him?

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: You wanna go out with him?

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: What makes you think he'll do it?

turns.speaker: CAMERON
turns.text: He seems like he thrives on danger

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: No kidding.  He's a criminal.  I heard he lit a state trooper on fire.  He just got out of Alcatraz...

turns.speaker: CAMERON
turns.text: They always let felons sit in on Honors Biology?

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: I'm serious, man, he's whacked.  He sold his own liver on the black market so he could buy new speakers.

turns.speaker: CAMERON
turns.text: Forget his reputation.  Do you think we've got a plan or not?

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Did she actually say she'd go out with you?

turns.speaker: CAMERON
turns.text: That's what I just said

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: You know, if you do go out with Bianca, you'd be set.  You'd outrank everyone. Strictly A-list.  With me by your side.

turns.speaker: CAMERON
turns.text: I thought you hated those people.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Hey -- I've gotta have a few clients when I get to Wall Street.

turns.speaker: CAMERON
turns.text: You got him involved?

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Like we had a choice?  Besides -- when you let the enemy think he's orchestrating the battle, you're in a position of power. We let him pretend he's calling the shots, and while he's busy setting up the plan, you have time to woo Bianca.

turns.speaker: CAMERON
turns.text: This is it.  A golden opportunity. Patrick can ask Katarina to the party.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: In that case, we'll need to make it a school-wide blow out.

turns.speaker: CAMERON
turns.text: Will Bogey get bent?

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Are you kidding?  He'll piss himself with joy.  He's the ultimate kiss ass.

turns.speaker: CAMERON
turns.text: Number one.  She hates smokers

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: It's a lung cancer issue

turns.speaker: CAMERON
turns.text: Her favorite uncle

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Dead at forty-one.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: He's pretty!

turns.speaker: CAMERON
turns.text: Okay!  I wasn't sure

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Assail your ears for one night.

turns.speaker: CAMERON
turns.text: It's her favorite band.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: You told me that part already.

turns.speaker: CAMERON
turns.text: Hell, I've just been going over the whole thing in my head and -

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Extremely unfortunate maneuver.

turns.speaker: CAMERON
turns.text: The hell is that?  What kind of 'guy just picks up a girl and carries her away while you're talking to her?

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Buttholus extremus.  But hey, you're making progress.

turns.speaker: CAMERON
turns.text: No, I ' m not.

turns.speaker: CAMERON
turns.text: You humiliated the woman! Sacrifice yourself on the altar of dignity and even the score.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Best case scenario, you're back on the payroll for awhile.

turns.speaker: CAMERON
turns.text: And he means that strictly in a non- prison-movie type of way.

turns.speaker: PATRICK
turns.text: Yeah -- we'll see.

turns.speaker: PATRICK
turns.text: What've you got for me?

turns.speaker: CAMERON
turns.text: I've retrieved certain pieces of information on Miss Katarina Stratford I think you'll find helpful.

turns.speaker: CAMERON
turns.text: Okay -- Likes:  Thai food, feminist prose, and "angry, stinky girl music of the indie-rock persuasion".

turns.speaker: PATRICK
turns.text: So what does that give me?  I'm supposed to buy her some noodles and a book and sit around listening to chicks who can't play their instruments?

turns.speaker: CAMERON
turns.text: Gigglepuss is playing there tomorrow night.

turns.speaker: PATRICK
turns.text: Don't make me do it, man

turns.speaker: PATRICK
turns.text: Cameron, I'm a little busy

turns.speaker: CAMERON
turns.text: It's off. The whole thing.

turns.speaker: PATRICK
turns.text: What 're you talking about?

turns.speaker: CAMERON
turns.text: She's partial to Joey, not me

turns.speaker: PATRICK
turns.text: Cameron -- do you like the girl?

turns.speaker: CAMERON
turns.text: Sure

turns.speaker: PATRICK
turns.text: Then, go get her

turns.speaker: CAMERON
turns.text: What'd you do to her?

turns.speaker: PATRICK
turns.text: I don ' t know.  I decided not to nail her when she was too drunk to remember it.

turns.speaker: CAMERON
turns.text: She hates you with the fire of a thousand suns .  That's a direct quote

turns.speaker: PATRICK
turns.text: She just needs time to cool off I'll give it a day.

turns.speaker: PATRICK
turns.text: You makin' any headway?

turns.speaker: CAMERON
turns.text: She kissed me.

turns.speaker: PATRICK
turns.text: Where?

turns.speaker: PATRICK
turns.text: What's the worst?

turns.speaker: CAMERON
turns.text: You get the girl.

turns.speaker: JOEY
turns.text: The vintage look is over, Kat. Haven't you been reading your Sassy?

turns.speaker: KAT
turns.text: Yeah, and I noticed the only part of you featured in your big Kmart spread was your elbow.  Tough break.

turns.speaker: JOEY
turns.text: They're running the rest of me next month.

turns.speaker: KAT
turns.text: Hey -- do you mind?

turns.speaker: JOEY
turns.text: Not at all

turns.speaker: JOEY
turns.text: Where ya goin?

turns.speaker: KAT
turns.text: Away.

turns.speaker: JOEY
turns.text: Your sister here?

turns.speaker: KAT
turns.text: Leave my sister alone.

turns.speaker: JOEY
turns.text: And why would I do that?
